metadata.case_name: Traders and Commission Agents v. State of Uttar Pradesh

facts.text: Petitioners in all cases are traders or commission agents dealing in agricultural produce.

The Uttar Pradesh Krishi Utpadan Mandi Adhiniyam, 1964 (U.P. Act No. XXV of 1964) as amended by U.P. Act No. 10 of 1970, provides for regulation of sale and purchase of agricultural produce and establishment, superintendence, and control of markets in Uttar Pradesh.

Preamble and Statement of Objects and Reasons indicate chaotic state in agricultural produce markets with innumerable charges, levies, exactions on producers, arbitrary awards in disputes, manipulation of weights and scales, denying producers fair share.
Agricultural produce defined under section 2(a) includes items from agriculture, horticulture etc., specified in schedule, processed forms, gur, rab etc.
Producer defined under section 2(p) as person who produces etc., not being one ordinarily engaged in business of storage etc.
Trader defined under section 2(y) as person engaged in buying/selling agricultural produce as principal or agent, including processing.
State Government notifies Market Area under section 6 after section 5 procedure.
No person shall carry on business as trader etc. in Market Yard without licence from Committee under section 9(2).
Market Committee constituted under section 13(1) with 23 members, including 10 from producers (8 elected under vii, 2 SC nominated under vii-a).
Committee functions include ensuring fair dealings under section 16(2)(i), powers to issue/renew/refuse licences under section 17.
Appeals to Director of Agriculture under section 25, revision by State Government under section 32.
Rule 70(4)(i): Committee issues licence if satisfied applicant solvent and desirable person.
Rule 76(1): Every consignment brought for sale shall be sold by open auction, except retail sales.
None of the petitioners have been refused a licence.

legal_issues.text: Whether constitution of Market Committee under section 13 prejudicial to traders as it gives perpetual majority to producers.
Whether entrustment of licensing to Market Committee instead of impartial authority is unfair and unreasonable restriction under Article 19(1)(g).
Whether Act and rule 70(4) provide no guidance/vague criteria for grant of licences, violating Articles 14 and 19(1)(g).
Whether obligation on petitioners to provide storage space to producers is unreasonable restriction on right to trade.
Whether rule 76(1) is ultra vires section 40 and imposes unreasonable restriction by mandating open auction sales.

petitioner_arguments.text: Constitution of Market Committee under section 13 highly prejudicial as perpetual majority of producers.
Entrustment of licensing to such Committee instead of impartial authority unfair and unreasonable restriction.
Act gives no guidance for grant of licences; rule 70(4) lays down two vague criteria.
Requirement to provide storage space to producers unreasonable restriction.
Rule 76(1) invalid and ultra vires section 40; unreasonable restriction by mandating open auction.

respondent_arguments.text: Committee consists of 23 members out of which only 10 from producers; no perpetual majority.

court_reasoning.text: Out of 23 members, only 10 producers (8 elected, 2 SC nominated); no perpetual majority; scheme under section 13 reasonable.
entrusting licensing to Committee representing various interests not prejudicial; hypothetical objection as no petitioner refused licence; appeal and revision provided.

Sufficient guidance from preamble, sections 16,17; form particulars; criteria 'solvent' (not bankrupt) and 'desirable/proper person' (upoyukta) adequate with Act's guidelines; speaking order required.
Committee to provide storage under section 16(2)(vii), rule 52(4); trader storage paid for; interim measure.
Rule 76(1) within section 40(2)(xxvii); ensures best price for producers via auction; not unreasonable; proviso for retail.

holdings.text: Constitution of Committee under section 13 reasonable, no violation of Articles 14, 19(1)(g).
entrustment of licensing to Committee valid; sufficient guidance in Act and rules.
Criteria under rule 70(4)(i) not vague; adequate guidance.
Rule 76(1) intra vires and reasonable restriction.

precedents_cited.relevance: Similar Acts upheld against unsuccessful attacks.

Lala Hari Chand Sarda v. Mizo District Council and Anr.
precedents_cited.relevance: No appeal/remedy and no principles for licensing; unlike present case.

precedents_cited.case_name: Harakchand Ratanchand Benthia and Ors. etc. v. Union of India and Ors.
precedents_cited.relevance: 'Suitability' vague without standards in Gold Control Act; present criteria with guidance different.

statutes_cited.name: Uttar Pradesh Krishi Utpadan Mandi Adhiniyam, 1964 (U.P. Act No. XXV of 1964, amended by U.P. Act No. 10 of 1970)
statutes_cited.relevance: Regulates markets, licensing, committee powers; challenged provisions upheld.

statutes_cited.name: Rules under the Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Licensing criteria, auction sales; upheld as providing guidance and reasonable.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Act and rules do not violate equality or trade freedom.

outcome.summary: All writ petitions challenging the validity of the U.P. Krishi Utpadan Mandi Adhiniyam, 1964 and rules thereunder on grounds of violation of Articles 14 and 19(1)(g) rejected; provisions upheld as reasonable regulations for producers' benefit.

key_quotes.text: The principal object of this Act is to come in aid of the producers who are generally ill-organised and are by far and large the exploited party in the bargain between unequals.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: There is sufficient guidance from the preamble and other provisions of the Act with which the members of the Committee owe their duty to be conversant.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: In order that the producers obtain the best price for their commodity, sale by open auction is prescribed under rule 76(1) to fulfil one of the important purposes of the Act.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: In the result all the applications fail and are dismissed.
key_quotes.speaker: court
